an9.45:4.1: “Reverend, they speak of a person called ‘freed both ways’.
an9.45:4.2: What is the one freed both ways that the Buddha spoke of?”
an9.45:5.1: “First, take a mendicant who, quite secluded from sensual pleasures …
an9.45:5.2: enters and remains in the first absorption.
an9.45:5.3: They meditate directly experiencing that dimension in every way. And they understand that with wisdom.
an9.45:5.4: Thus far the Buddha spoke of the one freed both ways in a qualified sense. …
an9.45:6.1: Furthermore, take a mendicant who, going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, enters and remains in the cessation of perception and feeling. And, having seen with wisdom, their defilements come to an end.
an9.45:6.2: They meditate directly experiencing that dimension in every way. And they understand that with wisdom.
an9.45:6.3: Thus far the Buddha spoke of the one freed both ways in an unqualified sense.”
